alert.note: Alert for Eastern Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued October 27 at 3:46AM AKDT until October 29 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...West to northwest winds 40 to 60 mph with gusts up to 80 mph possible. * WHERE...Eastern Aleutians. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A deepening low pressure system moves north of the Aleutian Chain through Friday night. Strong winds on the backside of the low will increase to hurricane force along the Eastern Aleutians by Friday afternoon. Winds will quickly diminish Saturday morning as the low moves towards the Gulf of Alaska.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
